author: paulmillr
content: Save one bit here, waste 192 bits everywhere else bc everything including pointers is uint256 ðŸ¤¨

author: sky.cactus
content: Saving bits on the wire is far more important than saving bits during execution.  Signatures are uncompresable with encoding schemes like RLP, gzip, etc. So it is even more critical to manually compress where possible than in other places where you can compress at a higher level.
